title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the query tab's data set editor page
description: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes are not listed. Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 2. In the data set editor, go to the data source page and change the data source. 3. The new data source does not have any database/table/column information. Observed behavior: No children node listing is displayed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
OB: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
SR: 1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 2. In the data set editor, go to the data source page and change the data source. 3. The new data source does not have any database/table/column information. Expected behavior: A children node listing should be displayed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
